thread.title: Emmerdale spoilers: Dementia sufferer Ashley coughs up blood during a violent fit
thread.title_full: Emmerdale spoilers: Dementia sufferer Ashley coughs up blood during a violent fit

author: Neil Batey
title: Emmerdale spoilers: Dementia sufferer Ashley coughs up blood during a violent fit
text:
Ashley with Bob moments before violent coughing fit (Photo: ITV) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It looks like the end is nigh for poor Ashley in Emmerdale , as the dementia sufferer has a coughing fit which leaves him choking on his own blood. 
The former village vicar starts the week in relatively good form back at the care home, even sharing a romantic dance with wife Laurel. 
In fact, it's Ashley's young son Arthur who falls ill first. When the Thomas family go to visit Ashley, the boy ends up vomiting. 
Sensing his mum is stressed, Arthur tries to convince Laurel that he's feeling fine - but the confused lad starts to believe his dad's condition is his fault. Laurel asks poorly Arthur how he's feeling (Photo: ITV) Read More 
Later, Bob pops in to see Ashley at the care home. Initially the two friends enjoy themselves, but matters take a serious turn when Ashley - played by John Middleton - suddenly can't stop coughing and finds blood on his hands. 
When Laurel hears about the incident, she's fraught with worry. Will Ashley pull through? Home is where the hurt is Faith and daughter Chas struggle to bond during a heartfelt chat (Photo: ITV) 
Chas and her mum Faith have a heart to heart to try to thrash out their differences. It’s orchestrated by Debbie after she notices the tension between them. But will it work? 
‘It’s very poignant,’ says Sally Dexter, who plays Faith. ‘I think they love each other but they can’t admit it because it would leave them both emotionally vulnerable.’ Read More
